p: According to Sartoratto et al. [ 80], the EO from A. triphylla showed inhibition values between 0.05 and >2 mg/mL against Gram-positive bacteria but it was not active against Gram-negative bacteria. However, Duarte et al. [ 81] reported that A. triphylla inhibited 12 Escherichia coli serotypes, with MIC values between 400–1000 μg/mL, showing moderate activity. A. polystachya showed inhibition values between 3.64 and 29.13 μg/mL against Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria, but it was not active against Pseudomonas aeruginosa [ 82]. A. gratissima showed inhibition values between 1000 and 4000 μg/mL against Gram-positive and 2000–4000 μg/mL against Gram-negative bacteria. The minimal bactericidal concentration (MBC) was twice the MIC in most of the cases and was the same as the MIC only for E. coli [ 8]. Aloysia sellowii showed inhibition values between 1.7 and 16 mg/mL against Gram-positive bacteria and between 6.7 and >20 mg/mL for Gram-negative bacteria. The MBC values were between two and three times the MIC. Aloysia sellowii was active against yeasts with MIC values between 4–16 mg/mL and Minimal Letal Concentration between 4–>20 mg/mL [ 14].
